sen.j: この帖から登場する比叡山の高僧・横川（よかわ）の僧都は、当時の平安貴族に人気の高かった恵心僧都（源信_(僧侶)）がモデルと言われ、終始人格者として描かれている。
sen.e: Yokawa no sozu, who firstly appeared in this chapter as the high-ranking Buddhist monk of Hieizan (Mt. Hiei), is said to have been created by looking to Eshin sozu, who was popular among the nobles in the Heian period, as model and was constantly depicted as a person of character.

sen.e: Ukifune, who had attempted suicide after being driven into a corner due to a dilemma between Nioumiya and Kaoru, lay in a coma at the foot of a big tree situated along the Yodo River.

sen.e: Sozu was on the way home from Hieizan in order to nurse his hahaama (mother nun) in 80's and imotoama (sister nun) in 50's who were suddenly taken ill in Uji on their way home from Hatsusemode (visit to Hatsuse-dera Temple) (visit to Hase-dera Temple).
